author: cnbc.com
title: Kelly Clifford—COO of LEAP—Recognized as Top Tech Influencer
text:
Legal Technology Resource Center 2018 Women of Legal Tech recognizes LEAP executive
JERSEY CITY, N.J.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- LEAP Legal Software, the leading cloud-based legal software technology provider, announces that Chief Operating Officer Kelly Clifford has been named by Legal Technology Resource (LTRC) as one of its 25 Women of Legal Tech. The recently released 2018 Women of Legal Tech annually recognizes female leaders influencing legal tech across the country.
“It is an honor to be recognized by the LTRC as part of this distinguished list,” said Clifford. “Throughout my career with LEAP across the world, I have found that the Company’s commitment to innovation is equally matched by its commitment to diversity, development and growth of its workforce.”
Every year the LTRC Board recognizes new female influencers as the Women of Legal Tech. LTRC’s Women of Legal Tech initiative is intended to encourage diversity and celebrate women in legal technology. This initiative launched in 2015 with a list of innovators and leaders in legal technology and with this year’s additions, that list now includes over 80 talented and influential women leaders.
For information about the Women of Legal Tech 2018, click here . You can learn more about Kelly Clifford and LEAP here .
About LEAP
As a legal case and practice management system, LEAP improves New Jersey, New York, and Massachusetts law firms' efficiency, productivity and profitability.
Law firms globally have relied on LEAP’s case management system since 1992 for innovative legal software to manage and store all their client and matter related information in one electronic file. For more information please visit www.leap.us .
